The September 8, 2023 earthquake in Morocco resulted in 2,946 deaths, 5,674 injured and damages equivalent to approximately 8% of the nation's GDP. Over 2 million people were affected, with many displaced and sheltering outdoors. Access to these provinces was challenging due to their mountainous nature, with landslides and rocks blocking the roads, slowing rescue efforts.

MedGlobal partnered with Faseelah and distributed food baskets to 450 households (2250 individuals) and medical supplies to first responders and a local clinic in Tafingoult (a village near Touradent) and constructed 30 robust shelters for the winter in high mountain villages. In partnership with Al Hayat Association, MedGlobal is currently sponsoring 35 surgeries for victims of the quake.

In addition, MedGlobal recently brought in USD $1.4 million of medical supplies in partnership with Association Amal Sal√® and Direct Relief to support victims of the quake in their ongoing recovery. Supplies include syringes, needles, sutures, catheters, oral rehydration salts, prenatal tablets, stethoscopes, medications used to manage and treat hypertension and PTSD and other needed medicines.

Meet Hamed, a brave baby in Sudan who has been fighting for every breath since birth.

At just three months old, Hamed was in a life-threatening situation, caught amidst clashes in his neighborhood in Al Thora, Omdurman. With the nearest health facility, Al-Roomy, closed due to the ongoing conflict in Sudan, accessing urgent medical care became a daunting challenge.

In this critical moment, hope emerged from Al Nada Hospital. This MedGlobal-supported hospital bridged the gap left by the closure of many health centers in Omdurman. 

Hamed's journey was difficult. His tiny body desperately needed oxygen to survive as he battled bronchiectasis, a condition where the airways in the lungs become abnormally widened. For 24 harrowing hours in the ICU, the sounds of bombings outside, the dedicated medical team worked tirelessly to save his precious life.

Hamed's story reminds us of the resilience of the human spirit and the vital importance of accessible healthcare. Together, we can continue to make a difference in the lives of those in need.
